conclusion: Analyze geometric relationships using sphere properties and refractive index to calculate distance SM.
A glass sphere with its right side silvered and a light source S on the axis of symmetry. Light reflects and enters the sphere.
Light source S is on the axis of symmetry, and light travels to the sphere's surface.
Angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, so ∠SMR = ∠RMS.
Light enters the sphere, reflects off the silvered surface, and returns, so ∠MRA = ∠RMA.
Total angle around point M is 360°, so ∠MRA + ∠RMA + ∠SMR + ∠RMS = 360°.
Angle of incidence equals angle of refraction, so ∠MRA = ∠RAS and ∠SMR = ∠ARS.
Using refractive index n = √3, we have ∠ARS = ∠RAS = 30°.
Distance SM is the hypotenuse of the right triangle formed by the light path, with sides R and R√3.
